What you say about chromas is very true.
So many champions have a lot of skins, but theres always 1 or 2 that you just always go back to because they're just so much better than all the rest.

For example when you play Vlad, even if you own all of the skins, its hard to break away from Soulstealer and Bloodlord. The same with Zombie and Spirit fire brand.

or PROJECT: Yi/Ashe, (or any of the project skins tbh) once you have those, all others seem invalid.

The only main champs I play, that I _regularly_ make the cycle through all the skins would be: 

Karthus
Poppy
Gnar
Shen

And to be honest it only happens with those champs _(with the obvious exception of Gnar where ALL the skins are evenly)_ because none of their skins are particularly great. 
_(like seriously, how easy would it be to change the colour of Karthus' particles?... come on)_
You know changing the colour of particles isn't as easy as loading up a palette and using "Fill" right?

When you have an entire design team who spends their days re-creating champs from scratch in order to create new skins (including completely changing their abilities...

Yes its pretty fuckin easy.

Take this guy for example:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MelZY_2hbKM

fully re-creates skin particles (not just the colour, but EVERYTHING) and it takes him less than a day (and he's just 1 guy with average equipment)

so yea.. if you have an entire team of professionals, that you employ for the sole reason of making skin particles... Yes. Its really really easy to change just the colour of the particle effects.

Maybe I'm just stupid, but where does it say it only took a day to make that custom skin? 

While I think the skin is pretty cool, it has a terrible colour scheme for visual clarity (would you even see minions anymore if that Q is on top of them?) and it also looks pretty clunky (Lux freezes after every action). That's why skins take time to make: Riot has to be 100% sure that the skin doesn't break or hurt the game in any way at all otherwise potentially thousands of players could be affected in a negative way.

Now I don't claim to know how the skin making process works, but as someone who is studying IT, I can guarantee you that almost anything that can go wrong will go wrong. It's better for Riot and players that skins take 2-3 months to make and release, and ensure that they are bug free, rather than release a skin every 2-3 days and hope to God your game doesn't decide to go ballistic.
